result.execSummary:
The defendant Preston Donnell Allen Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Court ordered defendant serve 3 DAYS in the House of Corrections, with credit for 3 DAYS time served.  
Court ordered defendant pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments by 4-6-2017; Nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment.
Court ordered defendant provide a DNA sample and pay all applicable costs and surcharges by 4-6-2017; Nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment.
Court sets restitution at $0.
Court does not suspend defendant's drivers license.
This is a time served disposition.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Preston Donnell Allen Jr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Preston Donnell Allen in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by State, Defense and Defendant.
Court ordered defendant serve 3 DAYS in the House of Corrections, with credit for 3 DAYS time served.  
Court ordered defendant pay Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments by 4-6-2017; Nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment.
Court ordered defendant provide a DNA sample and pay all applicable costs and surcharges by 4-6-2017; Nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment.
Court sets restitution at $0.
Court does not suspend defendant's drivers license.

Defendant Preston Donnell Allen in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Zachary A. Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel has no motions to be filed.  Case adjourned for plea and sentencing on 4/6/2015 at 1:30 pm, branch 3.  Court reminds defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  aw  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Preston Donnell Allen in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Michael White, student intern under the supervision of Marissa Santiago for Zachary A. Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
